page.title: 05FARMING,COLD ASHTON,DOYNTON.
page.content: Agriculture in this area is predominately devoted to{cattle}with the greatest emphasis on dairying, there being 4 Fresian dairy farms in this area alone. All the farms grow a few corn{crops}but being in the Sodbury Vale any arable crops are mainly devoted to cattle feed e.g. kale. The dairies, without exception sell their{milk}to wholesale distributers such as Bristol Co-op or the smaller local dairy Dunfords, for distribution in and around East Bristol. Mention must be made of 2 small holdings in Watery Lane.At one a herd of pedigree{goats}is kept and exhibited at major livestock shows.There is also a herd of Old Gloucester{cattle,}a breed almost extinct, originally used for Double Gloucester{Cheese.
